CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. This is due to the fact that it directly uses user input to create a script element and set its src attribute (in function d). An attacker could potentially inject malicious scripts by manipulating the input parameters, leading to XSS attacks. Additionally, the function also uses user input to set the backgroundImage style (in functions e and g) and to create an iframe (in functions f and h), which could also lead to XSS attacks if the input is not properly sanitized.
